verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Literal translation. Phrase 'The LORD spoke to Moses' is a common introduction in the Torah.

verses.text: Command the children of Israel to send out of the camp every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is unclean because of contact with a dead person.
verses.comment: Uncleanness categories match Leviticus descriptions.

verses.text: You must send both male and female out. You must send them outside the camp, so that they do not defile their camps, where I dwell among them.
verses.comment: Repetitive structure in Hebrew rendered as 'You must send...'

verses.text: The children of Israel did so, and sent them outside the camp. As the LORD spoke to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
verses.comment: Repeats theme of obedience to God's commands.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Common formulaic phrase.

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, 'When a man or woman commits any of the sins that people commit by breaking faith with the LORD, and that person is guilty,
verses.comment: Phrase 'breaking faith' renders the Hebrew 'me`al ma`al', meaning treachery.

verses.text: 'they must confess the sin they have committed. The person must make full restitution for the wrong, add one-fifth to it, and give it to the person wronged.
verses.comment: Restitution with additional 20% is clarified.

verses.text: But if the man has no close relative to receive restitution, the restitution owed to the LORD will go to the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement, with which atonement is made for the guilty person.
verses.comment: Legal provision for restitution in absence of kinsman (go'el).

verses.text: Every offering of all the holy things the children of Israel bring to the priest will be his.
verses.comment: Clarifies priestly privilege over sacred gifts.

verses.text: Each person’s holy things will be his own, but whatever anyone gives to the priest will belong to the priest.
verses.comment: Reiterates principle of gift-giving to priests.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Introduction to ritual for unfaithfulness.

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, 'If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
verses.comment: Literal rendering of adultery/infidelity language.

verses.text: and a man sleeps with her sexually, and it is hidden from her husband, and she is secretly defiled, and there is no witness against her and she was not caught in the act,
verses.comment: Phrase 'sleeps with her sexually' renders idiom 'lie with seed.'

verses.text: and the spirit of jealousy comes over him and he becomes jealous of his wife (whether she has defiled herself or not),
verses.comment: Reflects uncertain guilt of wife, jealousy of husband.

verses.text: the man must bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring as her offering a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He must not pour oil on it or put frankincense on it, because it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
verses.comment: Offering details match Levitical ritual patterns.

verses.text: The priest will bring her near and have her stand before the LORD.
verses.comment: Priest as mediator before God.

verses.text: Then the priest will take holy water in an earthen vessel, and some dust from the floor of the tabernacle the priest will take and put it into the water.
verses.comment: Holy water mixed with sanctuary dust—unique to this ritual.

verses.text: The priest will set the woman before the LORD, unbind the woman’s hair, and put in her hands the grain offering of remembrance, which is a grain offering of jealousy. The priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.
verses.comment: Unbound hair is sign of humiliation or mourning.

verses.text: Then the priest will make her swear an oath and say to the woman, 'If no man has lain with you, and you have not turned aside to uncleanness while under your husband, be free from this bitter water that brings a curse.
verses.comment: Curse wording closely follows Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: But if you have turned aside while under your husband, and if you have defiled yourself, and some man other than your husband has lain with you—'
verses.comment: Conditional phrasing as in Hebrew.

verses.text: then the priest shall put the woman under this oath of the curse, and the priest shall say to the woman, 'May the LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the LORD makes your thigh waste away and your belly swell;
verses.comment: Phrase 'thigh waste away and your belly swell' reflects probable euphemisms for reproductive organs.

verses.text: and may this water that brings a curse enter your body and make your belly swell and your thigh waste away.' And the woman must say, 'Amen, amen.'
verses.comment: Double ‘Amen’ is literal repetition for affirmation.

verses.text: Then the priest must write these curses in a scroll, and he shall wash them off into the bitter water.
verses.comment: Physical action of writing, washing writing into water.

verses.text: He will make the woman drink the bitter water that brings the curse, and the water that brings the curse will enter her and cause bitterness.
verses.comment: ‘Cause bitterness’ is literal, implying physical or emotional effect.

verses.text: Then the priest will take the grain offering of jealousy out of the woman's hand, wave the offering before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.
verses.comment: Waving offering is typical priestly action.

verses.text: The priest shall take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial portion and burn it on the altar, and afterward he will make the woman drink the water.
verses.comment: Order of ritual clarified: offering, then water.

verses.text: After he has made her drink the water, if she has defiled herself and has broken faith with her husband, the water that brings the curse will enter her and cause bitterness—her belly will swell and her thigh waste away, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
verses.comment: 'Become a curse' is literal reading of Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will be free and able to bear children.
verses.comment: Positive outcome of innocence—fertility.

verses.text: This is the law of jealousy, when a wife, though under her husband, goes astray and defiles herself,
verses.comment: Summary statement for legal procedure.

verses.text: or when a spirit of jealousy comes upon a man, and he becomes jealous of his wife. He shall set the woman before the LORD, and the priest will apply all this law to her.
verses.comment: Restates roles for husband, priest, and law.

verses.text: Then the man will be free from iniquity, but that woman will bear her guilt.’
verses.comment: Concluding pronouncement of legal liability.
